messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] vaccinations OT?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh, my goodness! I ve just been through whooping cough and they determined it solely through a medical history.  They asked me questions about my symptoms,
messages.messageBody:
>The only time I've regretted not vaccinating my children was I as watched my
>youngest girl who was two being held down by three or four strangers while a
>three foot (very thin) metal lead was passed down her nose into her lung
>for a
>sample for a test for whopping cough. At that moment, I wondered if I had
>indeed done the right thing.

Oh, my goodness!
I've just been through whooping cough and they determined it solely through
a medical history. They asked me questions about my symptoms, etc,
diagnosed it and prescribed some meds (that they promised would probably be
ineffective if it was whooping cough (and not something else) and for the
most part, were quite ineffective... which confirmed their
diagnosis.) (Besides, the tests for WC are notoriously inaccurate!)

If the rest of your kids ever come down with whooping cough, you should
know that it can be (and usually is!) diagnosed through a simple medical
history and symptoms.
I'm so sorry you and your daughter went through that and didn't know you
could resist! ...But now you DO know and can protect your other kids from
such institutional-medical-insanity.
Pax,
HeidiWD

"Self-reliance is the antidote to institutional stupidity." JTGatto,
Monarch Notes guide to One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] vaccinations OT?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/24/2003 7:08:20 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... The only time I ve regretted not vaccinating my children was I as watched my youngest girl
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/24/2003 7:08:20 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
ctbucknum@... writes:

> As for the Vac thing I'm sooo on the fence about it. Didn't know anything
> about the controversy with the first, gave into pressures with the second
> and while at the office watched as a small girl had a bad reaction to her shot.
>

The only time I've regretted not vaccinating my children was I as watched my
youngest girl who was two being held down by three or four strangers while a
three foot (very thin) metal lead was passed down her nose into her lung for a
sample for a test for whopping cough. At that moment, I wondered if I had
indeed done the right thing.

For the rest of the time, I'm fully confident in my decision to not vaccinate
my children, the oldest was the only one to be vaccinated, I was an
uninformed mother then, listening to my very own mother and I should have known better.

glena


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] vaccinations OT?
messages.msgSnippet: Ok thanks.  I thought it was something like that.  I had wondered if I was having some sort of mental blip and not understanding something that was perfectly
messages.messageBody:
Ok thanks. I thought it was something like that. I had wondered if I was having some sort of mental blip and not understanding something that was perfectly clear.

As for the Vac thing I'm sooo on the fence about it. Didn't know anything about the controversy with the first, gave into pressures with the second and while at the office watched as a small girl had a bad reaction to her shot. Now I have days when I feel obligated or guilty for not vaxing the two wee ones and think it would be no big deal. So I start hunting down the smart vax info on the net which brings me back to the "no way" can this be safe side and I go over my how to live without vaxing info..

It is very hard to live with the barrage from both sides. Each saying they are the right and good side with one major difference in the literature. The anti vax side wants you to get informed and make your own decision based on all the info you can find. The pro vax side will not even effectively inform the people who are in charge of administering the Vaccines about all possible complications etc.

Good luck
Teresa in Canada
----- Original Message -----
From: HMSL2@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2003 1:52 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] vaccinations OT?


In a message dated 6/24/2003 2:21:24 PM Eastern Standard Time,
ctbucknum@... writes:
I'm sorry but I can't make cense of your post. Could you clarify?

Teresa In Canada

Posts where run together. They are separated below
In a message dated 6/24/2003 10:55:48 AM Eastern Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:
No one can vaccinate your baby or circumsize them without your consent.
Keep
your baby with you and they won't have any choice about it! I never had any
problems with that stuff though. And I have two totally unvaccinated kids,
one
that started and I stopped them, the other got the full round before I had
researched it enough. :( poor guy. >>>>>>>End of starsuncloud@...
Post////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
My post is below. Is this where you where not understanding?

Recently our youngest had his 1 yr. shots and it was cruel the way they did
it, I thought. I had a read a little about them not needing them but hadn't
read
enough about it to know the risks and legalities. Several days later he
came
down with a high fever and has been grumpy since :(

What are the experiences of those interested in commenting on this? Email
me
off list if this does not interest others.

Thank you,
Laura D
